question_stem.en: A 22-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to a severe left frontal headache for the past 30 minutes. The patient has had similar pain every day for the past 3 days, and the episodes resolve spontaneously after about an hour. She has no other medical conditions and takes no medications. On physical examination, the patient appears restless and in pain. There is ptosis on the left side.
question_stem.zh: 一名22岁女性因左侧额部剧烈头痛30分钟来到急诊科。患者在过去3天中每天都有类似的疼痛，并且发作会在大约一小时后自发缓解。她没有其他疾病病史，也没有服用任何药物。体格检查显示，患者烦躁不安且疼痛。左侧有上睑下垂。

question.en: Which of the following findings is most suggestive of cluster headache in this patient?
question.zh: 该患者的以下哪项发现最提示丛集性头痛？

explanation.en:
This patient with recurrent, unilateral, severe headaches accompanied by ptosis has cluster headache, a type of trigeminal autonomic cephalalgia. Cluster headaches often present with rapid-onset, severe, unilateral pain that is typically periorbital, frontal, or temporal. Patients are often restless or agitated during episodes. Cluster headaches are often accompanied by ipsilateral autonomic symptoms, which may include:

•	Conjunctival injection and lacrimation
•	Nasal congestion or rhinorrhea
•	Ptosis, miosis, and anhidrosis

Headaches typically last 15-180 minutes and tend to occur in clusters (up to 8 times daily, often at the same time of day) over a period of several weeks. In some patients, clusters occur at similar seasons of the year. This clustering may suggest involvement of the hypothalamus, which regulates circadian rhythms. Treatment of acute headaches is often with oxygen or triptans (eg, sumatriptan); verapamil is frequently used for preventive treatment.

(Choice A) Both migraines and cluster headaches tend to have discrete episodes, so episodic nature is not a distinguishing feature in itself. The timing of the episodes (eg, around the same time every day, several days in a row) and the duration (eg, 15-180 min) are more characteristic of cluster headache, but the most obvious differentiating feature is the presence of autonomic symptoms.

(Choice B) Cluster headaches can occur in anyone, but they are more common in male patients.

(Choice C) Although cluster headaches are located in the frontal region, other types of headaches can also be frontal in location (eg, sinusitis, migraine), so this is not a specific differentiating feature.

(Choice E) Although cluster headaches are typically unilateral, migraine headaches are also often unilateral, so this is not helpful in distinguishing between those.
explanation.zh:
这位患者反复出现单侧剧烈头痛，并伴有上睑下垂，诊断为丛集性头痛，这是一种三叉神经自主神经性头痛。丛集性头痛常表现为起病迅速、剧烈、单侧疼痛，通常位于眼眶周围、额部或颞部。患者在发作期间常躁动不安。丛集性头痛常伴有同侧自主神经症状，可能包括：

•	结膜充血和流泪
•	鼻塞或鼻漏
•	上睑下垂、瞳孔缩小和无汗

头痛通常持续15-180分钟，并且倾向于成簇出现（每天最多8次，通常在一天中的同一时间），持续数周。在某些患者中，丛集性头痛发生在一年中相似的季节。这种聚集性可能提示下丘脑的参与，下丘脑调节昼夜节律。急性头痛的治疗通常使用氧气或曲坦类药物（如舒马曲坦）；维拉帕米常用于预防性治疗。

（选项A）偏头痛和丛集性头痛都倾向于有独立的头痛发作，因此发作性本身不是一个区别特征。发作的时间（例如，每天大约在同一时间，连续几天）和持续时间（例如，15-180分钟）更符合丛集性头痛的特征，但最明显的区别特征是自主神经症状的存在。

（选项B）丛集性头痛可发生在任何人身上，但在男性患者中更为常见。

（选项C）虽然丛集性头痛位于额部，但其他类型的头痛也可能位于额部（例如，鼻窦炎、偏头痛），因此这不是一个特定的鉴别特征。

（选项E）虽然丛集性头痛通常是单侧的，但偏头痛也常常是单侧的，因此这无助于区分。

summary.en:
This question tests the knowledge of cluster headache presentation and differentiating features from other headache types. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing autonomic symptoms in diagnosing cluster headaches.

To solve this question, focus on identifying the key clinical features presented in the vignette, particularly the presence of unilateral headache and ipsilateral ptosis. Recognize that autonomic symptoms are highly suggestive of cluster headaches.
summary.zh:
此题考查对丛集性头痛表现的认识以及与其他类型头痛的区别特征。它强调了在诊断丛集性头痛时识别自主神经症状的重要性。

要解决此问题，重点是识别短文中的关键临床特征，特别是单侧头痛和同侧上睑下垂的存在。认识到自主神经症状高度提示丛集性头痛。
